channel.title: Security Everywhere on COMP6441 Musings
channel.description: Recent content in Security Everywhere on COMP6441 Musings

item.title: Security Everwhere: WhatsApp & Telegram Media File Jacking
item.description: Recently the security peeps at Symantec released a proof of concept attack of “Media File Jacking” on the Android platform - namely through WhatsApp and Telegram.

item.title: Security Everywhere: DNS over HTTPS
item.description: Mozilla has ‘recently’ moved their DNS-over-HTTPS feature from the Testing to Release channel.

item.title: The Thinning
item.description: I got bored last week and watched The Thinning (2016).

item.title: Security Everywhere: Google Calendar Outage
item.description: It was 1:54am, and I was about to prepare to go to sleep.

item.title: Security Everywhere: JB Hi-Fi & Bing Lee Raids
item.description: Over a weekend, several JB Hi-Fi and Bing Lee stores were raided, having lots and lots of electronics and appliances stolen.

item.title: Security Everywhere: ANU Data Breach
item.description: If I had a dollar for every time the ANU data breach was said to be “sophisticated”… On the 17th May 2019, an alleged 19 years worth of records and data was reported to have been accessed and stolen.
